Reviews.Title: “Great pool, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: MidwestTrvlrs
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 days, the hosts were nice as were many of the guests. I would highly recommend if you are in the area

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Jason G
Reviews.Content: Clean well kept and a nice place to sun yourself nude. I like that no sexual activity is allowed out by pool so you can relax and not worry about being groped. Wish they rented rooms to locals it would be a great staycatioin. Recommend for day passes and what i have seen of rooms looked very nice and good value. J

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property, Prices, Slight Changes Would Help!”
Reviews.Author: Gr8buddies
Reviews.Content: Arrived late night to this nice property and lock box contained key. Checked in with Doug in AM.. very nice guy, friendly...great suggestions for shopping, entertainment, food. Room was comfy, clean, and Doug doted on us just enough to be helpful, yet not intrusive. Facility was really really well laid out, private, and beautiful setting. Hot tub was a gem... clean and relaxing... A more mature crowd than expected, but we were fine with that. We understood and followed all the rules. And understand Arizona laws... We would just like to offer 2 small wishes to ensure another stay at the property. 1. Pool had to be under 70 degrees. Unswimmable for us. Most public heated pools are kept at a minimum of 80 degrees. Vacation without a pool left us sitting longer in the hot tub. Not ideal for what we would have liked. Asked a few other guests their thoughts. Two agreed with us and said they would pay more per night for an 80 degree pool, while the other said he would rather have the lower price if that was the choice. Add us to the list of guests who would offer to pay more for pool heat, and although not scientific at all, may mean happier guests, and/or more of them. 2. Turning the heat off in the hot tub at 11:30pm... Again we understand the rules and laws and have no intent of breaking them. But to come home to a cold hot tub at Midnight or after the bar, when sitting in the tub would be a perfect end to an adult evening... seemed overboard protective to us. Again, if money or security are the issues, we would welcome security cams, and/or a security guard during busiest times or nights. Perhaps we are a bit idealistic, but our simple request is to punish those who break the rules, not everyone else who abides by them. Again... we truly love the property and want to return... Thank you to Doug for your dedication to us as your guests. We like the property enough to be honest, and enough to offer to pay more for the amenities we know cost more to offer. I would also add that a simple continental breakfast would offer social and nice extra perk, or even a Saturday eve happy hour social. But of all mentioned here, we could do without it just the same. Just thoughts to engage and delight your guests. -The Minnesota Boys

Reviews.Title: “4th visit in 5 years”
Reviews.Author: Kevin L
Reviews.Content: Partner and I had yet another wonderful visit at the Villa. Recently spent 5 nights at the Villa. Doug and Kenny do all they can to make everyone comfortable and welcome. The recent updates and improvements show pride of ownership and desire to encourage and welcome repeat visits. The attentive eye of managment is not a negative for us, and in fact was quite welcome when one guest decided to venture beyond pool grounds and gate "naked" to greet his arriving afternoon "guest/hook up?" The managers have a wonderful property, and maintain it as such. This includes having to sometimes offer - as earlier review comments "a trip to the guidance counselor" for those guests who when mixing fun, sun and alcohol revert to being adolescent boys who make poor choice in actions. For us, certainly appreciate the care and attention the owners extend to be sure everyones visit is fun, safe and enjoyable. And with such care, assure that the Villa remains open and available to all, who visit Phoenix and play in the Sun! Look forward to next visit all ready!

Reviews.Title: “We Will Return”
Reviews.Author: Mr. Matt
Reviews.Content: My traveling partner and I had a most enjoyable three night stay here earlier this month. Management was spot-on in assuring we were comfortable & offered excellent suggestions for dining,, etc. Rental rates.. very reasonable for what you get. Our rooms were exceptionally clean and very well appointed ,including the kitchen area. Grounds and pool area were quiet and most relaxing . Suggestions.. If you are offended by nudity around the pool ..stay elsewhere!!!., Also a car would be a plus if you plan some touring around the Phoenix area. Highly reccomended for those open to an alternative life-style... and I repeat ..WE WILL RETURN. ... ..

Reviews.Title: “You have to experience it yourself”
Reviews.Author: Jacques_Alex
Reviews.Content: Some of the recent reviews had me hesitate booking a room for it was so negative compare to what I had experience several years ago. I do not regret staying there with my partner on our last day in Phoenix after a week long touring the North part of Arizona. The owner was pleasant, the room decent and the grounds met our expectations. So we think that you'll have to see for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Royal Villa continues to be a great place ---”
Reviews.Author: DwainChicagoIL
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Royal Villa several times a year since they first opened their first property and continue to be impressed with the total experience. The owners continue to upgrade the facilities both in the rooms and in the common areas. How they can do it at the prices they charge escapes me. But, the atmosphere is the best part; it's a relaxing place to soak up the sun (literally) with other gay men but without the attitude or bathhouse mentality some (like maybe the previous poster) might be looking for. Central location convenient to gay bars as well as downtown Phoenix theater and sporting events. What's not to like?

Reviews.Title: “I was actually kicked out for doing nothing!!!”
Reviews.Author: az g
Reviews.Content: I was laying back in the pool sitting next to another day pass person. We were not even talking to one another! We had been in conversation but we both we actually dozing off. The owner came over and kicked us both out saying we were about to have sex in his pool. There was absolutely no touching going on....but he yelled and left. The sad part is I had been there a few times. I had never done anything against the rules or inappropriate on those premises. I was absolutely shocked at how we both were treated. No wonder it is never full as far as the hotel or the pool. I had met several nice people there each and every time I was there for conversation. With rude and uncalled for attitude by the management that I experienced the last time I was there, no wonder it is never busy and surely to be out of business soon!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay....”
Reviews.Author: Wetfella8062
Reviews.Content: We stopped for three nights in the Safari suite which was pleasant, clean and situated right by the pool. Doug made us very welcome. A car is definitely needed especially to get to the various bars and restaurants. I've never drank so little alcohol on holiday with the need to drive! Enjoyed it though and I'd recommend it for a short stop over

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool and sun area.”
Reviews.Author: SimonRH
Reviews.Content: Lovely pool and sun bathing area. Rooms clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: mross_11
Reviews.Content: My third visit to the Royal Villa left me feeling rested, satisfied, and very well taken care of. A great friend and I attended recently and the stay was fantastic. On this visit we toured the different rooms and found them all inviting in their own unique ways and designs. Kenny and Doug have done a remarkable job creating an atmosphere of comfort and style in all the units. The pool and jacuzzi are kept up to a standard i have rarely seen in other resorts. The sparkeling pool is a very inviting 80 degrees and the jacuzzi with powerful jets of water pounding your back gracefully and or coming down from above soothe away any stress the day may offer. Not only is the staff friendly, the other occupants are also cool. We always meet some nice people when we stay and remain friends with them still. The location is also a plus being midtown. Quite frankly this is an oasis where the outside world remains outside, and the inside is my own paradise. Very reasonable pricing, consistent friendliness, marvelous landscaping, perfect pool and jacuzzi makes this place my home in the desert whenever i find the chance to visit Phoenix. My thanks to Doug and Kenny for their hospitality. I hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “A GEM IN THE DESERT VALLEY!”
Reviews.Author: muscletongue3000
Reviews.Content: have heard about the royal villa resort over the years. surprised that it had moved from turney to 12th st n.! what a surprise. couldn't ask for a more central, clean, comfortable and friendly location. was in town for a convention so divided my first two days at the royal villa and the last two days at a chain resort in the north end of the city -- wish i could have gotten out of the second, prepaid booking. i felt so at home at the royal villa resort! so convenient to my favourite pauncho's buffet on indian school road, rosco's sport bar andf grill and their great food and for the chute for playingl. doug - kenny -- many thanks for making me so welcome. for your recommendations and supplying local information. just wish that i had stayed there previously -- have been to phoenix about 20 times and realize i have missed out on this "gem"! --gary

Reviews.Title: “Ideal nude sunbathing day pass”
Reviews.Author: KevinandSteve
Reviews.Content: Earlier this week I had my first visit here, spending two days enjoying day passes. I had wondered whether this might be too much sun in Phoenix and June, but the resort is ideally designed, with water features and light shade, to make for wonderfully pleasant days. There is a swimming pool with cool waterfall as well as a spacious hot tub with both jets and a massaging water curtain. The grounds are comfortable and clean, towels (and free wi-fi) provided, and there is a refreshing shower with bath gel, shampoo, and conditioner. The staff are welcoming and helpful. I look forward to going back again!

Reviews.Title: “Love the remodel”
Reviews.Author: Triumph_Go
Reviews.Content: Always a pleasure to stay at your hotel. Love the changes you have made to the room and office. Wish I could work and stay here all summer!

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet, Relaxing, Private Getaway”
Reviews.Author: hkyd
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Royal Villa Resort last weekend. It was our first time in Phoenix, and Kenny, one of the owners, made us feel quite relaxed and welcome. He was very helpful and attentive during our stay, and the resort itself is clean and makes the stress melt away. In particular, the open-air jacuzzi is wonderful, especially at night in the cool Phoenix air. The jacuzzi waterfall gives a nice massage, too. The resort is also clothing-optional, which is a nice gay-friendly feature. The only thing we would have liked is a phone in the room, but other than that, the place is absolutely divine! It is a great place to relax and unwind...highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “WANT TO RELAX & ENJOY - ROYAL VILLA IS THE PLACE”
Reviews.Author: POOCHPAGANO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Royal Villa for 5 days. We wanted to get away from the snow and cold in New York and this was the perfect spot. One of the owners, Doug, was very attentive, and all of his suggestions for sightseeing, shopping, eating could not have been better. The place is clean and safe. The clientele- quiet and friendly. Great pool, nice pleasant atmosphere and near to all. Great deals on car rentals thru Enterprise and almost everything from eating out..to the movies..to the bars to shopping is just a short ride. Weather was more than perfect. It's a friendly place to go along with the friendly city.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Change anything”
Reviews.Author: DonDetroit
Reviews.Content: Frozen should have gone to Palm Springs...or to the Baths where he could sit in the hot tub all night long. I've been a guest at the Royal Villa many times and cannot fault any of their "rules". They are designed from years of past experience to keep the place a pleasure to stay at for ALL the guests. If you want to stay at a party resort, it best to read the description first.

Reviews.Title: “Would be nice but the owner needs to sell and move on.”
Reviews.Author: MNfrozen_10
Reviews.Content: Our room was ok, the owner needs to relax the rules a bit.... He turns off the hot tub at 11:00 PM, that's crazy, you can sit in it, but no bubbles (That is nuts!!! get clue owner - if you want repeat customers) also counts towels like they are something to be proud of...very average gym style towels and worn. The pool was nice (not heated) and the hot tub was also nice, with a shower/water fall (that is turned off at 8:00pm - once again owner - get a clue - people are on vacation and want to relax - if your worried about a wild party, then don't let outside peeps in the joint after midnight). I understand it's the only joint in town, so you don't really have very many choices. I will probably go to Palm Springs next time - I think it's time for this owner to sell out and move on - he can't see that he really has gotten crazy with little crazy rules and the does not make for a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “And again: Perfect vacation at a perfect resort”
Reviews.Author: gdm1
Reviews.Content: For me the Royal Villa Resort is truly my home abroad. This year I came 'home' with my partner after visiting Vegas. I really love the athmosphere at the Villa and especially the hospitality of Douglas and Kenny. Also my partner felt in love with this place and we unpatiently wait to come back next year. Luckily our vacation was impacted by Eyjafjallajökull, the famous vulcano on Island, which let to a longer stay at the Villa. Douglas and Kenny really putting a lot of effort in keeping the ground beautiful and making the guests feel like home!

Reviews.Title: “So glad we booked this resort”
Reviews.Author: NYCTvlr
Reviews.Content: This gay, clothing optional resort was great in every way. The owner recommended the apartment since we were staying for 9 days and while it was just a little older in style and comfort, we had a wonderful stay. The pool and hottub are clearly the centerpieces of the resort and they didn't disappoint. Located within walking distance of a couple of the gay bars and a short cab ride from Charlie's. All in all a great place to stay in Phoenix. Can't wait to go back - especially when there are a few more other guests.

Reviews.Title: “My local friends couldn't get a room here.”
Reviews.Author: Incollege
Reviews.Content: Any place that won't even support the local community...even worse, flat out BANS them from staying at their establishment, is SAD SAD SAD! I will not recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “another nice stay”
Reviews.Author: StChris
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice in the last 5 months. The location is in a residential area but Camelback Road is only a couple minutes by car. Rooms have microwave and full-size fridge, and they now supply shampoo. The pool and in-ground hot tub area is nice and relaxing. Doug and Kenny can advise on restaurants and bars and they can print off boarding passes for you. The rates are very reasonable. If you don't need 4-star luxury rooms, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Boyz N The Hood”
Reviews.Author: alexrobert
Reviews.Content: This resort truly is a find! Nondescript location with easy access to great dining & nightlife.Once inside you'll love the the pool and spa ....the gardens are beautiful. The hosts are sweet and attentive......for the price you get a great room with kitchen ....def worked for us. We def will book again & stay longer. (cheers from London, ON)

Reviews.Title: “Find another place!”
Reviews.Author: franknmann
Reviews.Content: Uppity rule-oriented staff. Rooms need a bad updating. Pool was nice, but that's about it. If you're 70+ and are in bed by 8 (the way the owners prefer you are) then you'll fit right in. Otherwise avoid this place!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for the price range”
Reviews.Author: rjlink
Reviews.Content: The standard room isn't going to bowl you over with luxury (nor should you expect it to at the price), but it's more than adequate and it's got a full kitchen. The proprietors are nice and welcoming. The pool and spa are great. The location is deceptive because it doesn't look like a great neighborhood, but it's just an unimpressive pocket amidst a lot of great stuff.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place to Relax and Refresh!”
Reviews.Author: RcktMan350
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to stay at Royal Villa and I'm looking forward to future visits. Unfortunately, both times I have been on business and only able to stay one night, but both times I have been impressed. The hosts are very friendly and the attention to detail and maintaining a comfortable environment is evident. Royal Villa rivals and surpasses many of the Palm Springs resorts when it comes to rooms and amenities. If traveling on business, you definitely can't beat the price compared to the area hotels. I appreciate the fact you can relax nude poolside, in the hot tub, or in your room in a non-sexual environment. The hosts stress no public sexual activity. I highly recommend Royal Villa for business or pleasure travel. In fact, instead of Palm Springs for my next vacation, I'll be at Royal Villa.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but needs an upgraded touch”
Reviews.Author: portlandboy03
Reviews.Content: First let me say that this place is adorable and the staff has been nothing less than the best. Exterior is cute but the interior reminds me of an episode of the golden girls circa 1984 BUT I think there are only a few things that are needed to make this place fantastic. * Leave the hot tub controls on past 10pm---when it's 116 degrees we don't need it nearly as much as we would like it at night when it's chilly. (!!!!!!! I can not emphasis this enough!!!!!!) *the music cuts off at 930-10ish. My grandma even thought that was a little early to shut everything down. *I would pay $20 more a night for better soap, shampoo, and such. I am all for the "resort" atmosphere. Now lets put it all together *I understand the no tanning oils at the pool and the rules on the wall but a few less rules might make it more fun and we go on vacation for fun. The Arizona law is just important to me as it is the next person BUT a posted rules is a bit nutty. It could be better said in a cute binder like a large hotel might provide with food suggestions, directions to gay places. Overall just a more human touch would really turn this place into a destination to desire.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great time again!”
Reviews.Author: gdm1
Reviews.Content: Well, I think it has been my 8th, 9th or x time at the Royal Villas. And it is always like coming home. Doug and Kenny are super hosts and friends. I'll be back.......

Reviews.Title: “Great Time Was Had By All!”
Reviews.Author: thepartyguys
Reviews.Content: My buddy and I just spent 8 nights at the Arizona Royal Villa and had a great time. We stayed in the Safari Room which is seperate from the rest but right in the heart of the action. The people we met were very relaxed and friendly and the owners are great guys who really take pride in their property. The location is amazingly convenient to many bars, restaurants, shopping, you name it! We'll definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: cpete
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect overnight in Phoenix. The fact that it was a gay, clothing-optional was icing on the cake. The Safari suite was very private, adorable and with a nicely appointed kitchenette.

Reviews.Title: “Was a great time”
Reviews.Author: Biggun7729
Reviews.Content: My partner and i stayed there over the Labor Day Weekend 2008. We had a great time even though the city had a major wind storm the night before we got there and there was no power. Doug and Kenny were very gracious. There were a few couples that showed up after we got there. Both Kenny and Doug continiously appolgized about the power. We told them that it was beyond thier control. To top it off the temp was over 110 degrees and very humid. Overall the weekend was fun and relaxing. We will diffently be back, but this time over the Memorial Day Weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time for a Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: Knockinathebackdoor
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a relaxing weekend at the Royal Villa, and I highly recommend it. The grounds are lovely, the Deluxe Room (the least expensive offered) was large and clean and poolside (as are all the rooms), the owner was friendly and accommodating. It was a beautiful weekend in October and the pool was never crowded as I thought it could possibly be as they offer day passes. It was never a “scene”, but a relaxing space to enjoy a clothing optional environment - which is why I chose to try it out. Simply put, I’ll stay there again when I get back to Phoenix, I recommend it and hope you have a great time!!

Reviews.Title: “Such a relaxing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JPSUDS143
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Arizona Royal Villa Resort for 2 weeks and I must say that it was well worth the price. The rooms are clean and the staff is very helpful. We got great advice on where to go shopping to save some money on food, since they offer some rooms that you can cook in. Makes it feel like home for those that like to stay in and cook rather than spend extra money everyday on eating out. Plus the staff made sure that we were comfortable and to ask if we needed anything. Had the Laptop with us for use on there Network and was really happy that we could plan a road trip online. I would stay here again no questions asked. The jacuzzi was great. They have a waterfall that takes all the tension away and the pool is chilled so that you can get some relief from the summer sun. The temps there in Aug were 103F -113F that was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Policy”
Reviews.Author: workandplay1
Reviews.Content: For Memorial Day Weekend, I wanted to get away from home and decided to book a room at the Royal Villa. I went online and placed a reservation via their website. Nothing else happened, no follow up email or phone call, nothing. I thought that I had better follow up and call the hotel directly myself, but was told that they didn't have my reservation but do have rooms available so I proceeded to make a reservation. As I was giving the gentleman my information, he asked for my phone number. I gave it to him, he replied, "do you live in Phoenix?" I answered yes and he said that he could not allow me to stay there. I asked him why and all I was told is that the owners do not allow locals to stay at the hotel. But they do allow day passes to locals. I was totally confused and bewildered by this. I can understand that maybe in the past the hotel has had problems with locals, but give me a break. I will definately not recommend a place that can not even support its local gay community.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: scott60606
Reviews.Content: Nice place, overall. I've never been to it before and have never been to the other property (before they bought this one). Was impressed. Better than I thought it would be. Room was clean and comfortable. I liked the fact it had a full kitchen (but no dishwasher). Since I dont wash dishes (especially when on vacation). I bought paper plates and plastic silverware from the grocery store which worked just fine. I liked the small area outside the room to sit down and relax. All rooms face the pool. Pool and hot tub were superb! Nice good looking guys hanging out by the pool. Mainly guys in their 30's and 40's. A couple guys a little older but mainly 30s-40's. All guests were pretty friendly. You can sun/swim nude by the pool which I took advantage of. Very nice! To the management: the only thing I would like to see different is MORE palm trees on the property. I only saw two. To vacationers like me from the North: Palm trees = relaxing vacations. More palm trees near the pool area would have made the stay PERFECT.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE this place”
Reviews.Author: ClarkdaleGuys
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Villa many times, and I have always found it to be very clean and the owner and employees are down to earth and pleasant and concerned that their guests are having a good time. The grounds are immaculate and tastefully decorated and we always notice upgrades and improvements whenever we go there. The Villa is close to some of Phoenix's hot spots, and it is even possible to walk to some of the clubs. There are lots of very attractive guests staying there from all age groups and each and every person there is made to feel at home. I'll try to go there as often as possible!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just fair”
Reviews.Author: nmokie
Reviews.Content: Rooms were a little dingy, could have been cleaner, towels were stained, a/c did not work well. Management offered another room if the a/c did not kick in. It did finally cool off, but the next day it was still a little warm. Pool and hot tub were great. Met some nice people around the pool area. Pool area was in need of some new furniture and more shade. Great concept, but needs a little updating, especially the a/c.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: repeatcustomer
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, relaxing, fun. We enjoyed our stay as much as our visits to Warm Sands in Palm Srings. Great pool and jacuzzi. Close attention to detail. Attentive staff. And our "Poolside Suite" was a treat. These guys know how to run an inn.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hottub I've Enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: kevSantha
Reviews.Content: Spend a weekend at Royal Villas. This is my second time. First was at their old place. This place is an improvement from the old one and easier to find. The rooms are larger and the place is very clean. I found the host to be friendly and very hospitable. I could walk to a couple of bars. Parking was a potential problem if it is too full, but there was another lot at the old place. I would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Run, Run, Run the other way”
Reviews.Author: GuyTravlin
Reviews.Content: This place sounds nice and could be, but they need to take lessons in customer service from the guest houses in Key West. The rooms are a little worn and could be cleaner, but some of the staff is very rude to the guest. There are not many all male guesthouses in Phoenix, but I would cross this one off your list!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: RickN6900
Reviews.Content: I had looked at the pictures for the poolside suite and booked it but when I arrived I found the pictures did not do the room justice at all. It was very nice, all new, clean and modern. The grounds, pool and spa were the same. The water fall in the spa was great and it is quite large. Everything was very clean and the owners were great! Will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fun to be naked by the pool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The place is very cute. Our suite was large and well apointed. It was built in the 40's or 50's so it's not like a Hilton. It was kind of a quiet week but still several friendly and attractive men were staying there. It was fun getting naked by the pool. I'm one who "shouldn't be seen naked" but I did it anyway. We had a very nice time. The hosts were great.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK; Clean and mid-priced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Royal Villa is a nice mid-priced small hotel for gay men. I don't know what the other reviewer found so objectionable. Yes, it IS in need of an upgrade, but when I was there it was very clean and very reasonably priced (compared to some other hotels in the area). I didn't find it at all hard to locate, but then I had the advantage of daylight and it sounds as if the other reviewer had to find it after dark. Best rule of thumb -- if the hotel does not meet your expectation, TALK TO THE MANAGER. You'd be surprised; they might just make it right or at least assist you in finding other accomodations. The Arizona Royal Villa is all right.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here based on their website's description. Big mistake! I should have left when I saw the room but it was too late at night. Very difficult to find the hotel first of all. The room was terrible. Musty, old, and very dank. I must mention I was there in December last year, so maybe this is a summer only destination. But still, there's no excuse for such an old room. It was not cheap! AVOID this place!

HotelInfo.Name: Arizona Royal Villa Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 4312 N 12th Street, Phoenix, AZ 85014
